title: Homograph attack bypass cause redirection

profile.name: Vanilla
profile.about: Vanilla is a powerfully simple discussion forum you can easily customize to make as unique as your community.

vulnerability_information:
Hi Team,
I read the report #563268 which is a great report that was able to trick users to click on links which appears to them normal links but in fact its malicious links So I tried to find a way to make this happen again and I found out that there is a  Homograph attack bypass which can redirect users to malicious sites.

**Vulnerable URL:**
```
https://rinkerboats.vanillacommunities.com/home/leaving?Target=http://www.ɡооɡⅼе.ϲоⅿ\:@%20
```
**Message:**
```
You are now leaving Rinker Boat Company. Click the link to continue to http://www.ɡооɡⅼе.ϲоⅿ\:@ 
```
This will redirect users to http://www.xn--l-r1aa78phba.xn--m-zmb38a/:@ and not http://www.google.com
In Homograph attack basically an attacker can change text to another and it will look like the original text for example google.com and ɡооɡⅼе.ϲоⅿ are not the same. You can know more 

##References:
https://www.charset.org/punycode?encoded=http%3A%2F%2Fxn--eby-7cd.com%2F&decode=Punycode+to+normal+text
http://www.chromium.org/developers/design-documents/idn-in-google-chrome

##Similar Reports:
https://hackerone.com/reports/861940
https://hackerone.com/reports/29491
https://hackerone.com/reports/175286
https://hackerone.com/reports/271324
https://hackerone.com/reports/143975

## Impact

Redirect users to malicious websites.

Regards,
Malek

activities.message:
Hi team,
I found another bypass which can appear to the user more normal.
**Vulnerable URL:**
```
https://rinkerboats.vanillacommunities.com/home/leaving?Target=https://www.ɡооɡⅼе.ϲоⅿ\@%20
```
**Message:**
```
You are now leaving Rinker Boat Company. Click the link to continue to https://www.ɡооɡⅼе.ϲоⅿ\@
```
##Details:
This payload (https://www.ɡооɡⅼе.ϲоⅿ\@%20) worked because of the \ and @. 
If we use / instead of \ the homograph attack won't work. and the site will show the real url (www.xn--l-r1aa78phba.xn--m-zmb38a) 
and we used the @ to manipulate the filter and let the site sanitize the domain after the @ and not the one before it. but if I add a domain after the @ then the url will look suspicious but surprisingly if you add anything after the @ the attack will work so I added a space %20 to make the url more normal.
Hi security team, sorry to bother you, but Is there anyone looking into this ?
Over 3 months now and still no response!!

Sorry for the delay. We've had some personnel changes that caused us to fall behind.
This has been previously reported and a fix has been implemented and released to our open source project in June of 2021. If you install the latest version of Vanilla, you will see that the user is shown the decoded link and asked if they want to proceed.

Hi @blutarch, you're saying that this has been fixed in your open source project. 
But the vulnerability meant in this report is not in your source code project but it's in the subdomain ```rinkerboats.vanillacommunities.com``` which appears to be in the scope and like I said it's a bypass of #563268 so the bug was already accepted before, and I tested the vulnerability just now and it appears it still work So I think it should be considered as a valid vulnerability not a duplicated one!

You can reproduce the vulnerability by visiting the link above and also Here is a POC video as proof:
{F1494410}
@malek Thank you for your report. I am lowering the severity based on the CVSS score

Hi @dredman, thanks for reviewing the report and for the bounty. But I think the bounty should be more as I only got $50 and the report #563268 got $150 even it's the same vulnerability in the same place with the same impact!
We've opened a ticket for this issue that's contained in our backlog based on this report and will address this as we have opportunity.
